page.title: 07HEANOR PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The total cost of rebuilding since 1978 has now been raised - Â£220,000.The church now comprises three different architrectural styles, the tower (15th century), the north aisle (Victorian), the remainder (modern). Subsidence of foundations necessitated demolition of the south side, choir and sanctuary. The former east end is now a church hall with outside paved area and modern kitchen and storeroom facilities. There are toilets and an upstairs meeting room. Gas heating and carpeting have made the service much more comfortable. Movable pews and altar allow us to vary the arrangement for different occasions and sliding doors permit extension of seating into the hall when necessary. Most regular worshippers are very satisfied with the rebuilt church.
